intro: Edraianthus wettsteinii, commonly known as the Wettstein's edraianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
